title: Democrats Drop Vaping Tax From Senate Plan as They Negotiate Bill Details
sub_head: A House-passed bill would have taxed e-cigarettes like regular ones but senators objected, including Nevada’s Cortez Masto
body:
WASHINGTON—Senate Democrats are dropping a proposal that would have imposed taxes on vaping, removing a $9 billion provision backed by some public-health advocates from the party’s social spending and climate bill, people familiar with the matter said.
Lawmakers made the decision as they wrap up the details of the $2 trillion Build Back Better package and attempt to get it through the Senate before Christmas. Sen. Catherine Cortez Masto (D., Nev.), a Finance Committee member in a tough re-election race, pushed to remove the tax and helped force its deletion.
